communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Wasilla Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Wasilla Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Sorry for the delay on reply, the email was flagged by our spam filters. I have attached our response to your request. Please let me know if you are unable to open the attachment.

-Amanda

[cid:image001.png@01D9BE1F.66583260]

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Wasilla Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello again,

Sorry, I forgot to mention in the last email that our email address for records requests should be wpdadmin@cityofwasilla.gov<mailto:wpdadmin@cityofwasilla.gov> and that our mailing and physical address should be 801 N Wasilla-Fishhook Road, Wasilla, AK 99654 (we moved in 2020). When I went to the MuckRock page for our agency, our public records website is also incorrect and should be https://www.cityofwasilla.gov/services/departments/police/public-records.

-Amanda

[cid:image001.png@01D9BE22.3BB39290]

communications.subject: Your Orlando public records request #23-8808 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Orlando ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-8808 has been submitted successfully. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Orlando.

communications.subject: [ACTION REQUIRED] Your Orlando public records portal account
communications.communication:
Use this to confirm your account. The link is only valid for 24 hours.

Orlando

************************************************************************
Hello Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau!
************************************************************************

You can confirm your Orlando public records portal account by copying and pasting the URL below into your web browser. This link is only valid for the next 24 hours.

Magic link: https://records.orlando.gov/users/confirmation?confirmation_token=oZxLgZ83y9425LVFWZzi

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Orlando public records request #23-8808
communications.communication:
Orlando ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-8808: Thank you for contacting the City of Orlando. We have received your request, however, we receive hundreds of requests each week. We will process your request in the order it was received. Once we begin to process your request we will notify you if the request will take more than 30 minutes.   Pursuant to City Policy, if producing the requested records will require more than 30 minutes of total staff time, we will provide an estimate of the labor costs to retrieve the records before we begin the work. City policy also requires that we collect a deposit before work begins on records requests when an estimate is $100 or more.   Please note that no fees are due now and we will notify you if we estimate it will require more than 30 minutes to retrieve the documents you requested. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Orlando.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Beaverton Records Request Portal
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau , 
Thank you for registering with the Beaverton Oregon Public Records Request Portal. 
Your Login ID is:  149682-97400483@requests.muckrock.com 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password 
Please login to My Records Center to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available.

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: P006863-072123
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 7/21/2023 and given the reference number P006863-072123 for tracking purposes. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the records you are requesting, and, if there are records, the approximate volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. The Police Department is unsure if it is the custodian of the requested record(s) as a search of records has not yet been completed. You will soon receive a message directly from Police Department staff about whether the Police Department is the custodian of the records or not. 
 
Beaverton Police Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HcxXYXVQYH9HzEGQxDOVB68EN9ucdoBhthj1QuyFHuNNSWriz7aNzpXJ4z-2BbhaIsLUCFtydXIM8orR1hlbJEKW0-3DHgBR_8i4lWdMPsNZJgzYf3pvanpdkQs-2FFwS2VvVUzweBg-2FGQMsdo8GhnTA4jqVee-2Fsspk2rZwxhAAZSPbyjKTSwM3rhvp8WlTGrTxuI7QszzytNuaZLuePZnVWhwQMFTVFcZCZ79iZBT-2FXw6v8LXq3Ik0jGCDjjnkoVSbznp9Hriqg3pC1uOXsXKyl8zkEzMG4ZQkZSmiRGXcD7HXW65sfwOz14-2FBDr1GoA4zqyi318vQ4dg-3D)

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P006863-072123
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 21, 2023, Reference # P006863-072123 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
Beaverton Police Department received a public information request from you on July 21, 2023. Your request mentioned: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau" 
The Beaverton Police Department has reviewed its files and located responsive records to your request. The Beaverton Police Policy Manual may be found at this link. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HVf-2BuQxhOs2ewrPFksszXa9Js3-2BCSrLFjrvSwZjbQLu42nQH-2BH9-2FdaF7hmRoTZrjgE3JocJE9eapWUKXbSckiQZTR81uWjkZ157MNhEmSlKBFxbbYaNiy83AKEibB68SLw-3D-3DwRMy_8i4lWdMPsNZJgzYf3pvanpdkQs-2FFwS2VvVUzweBg-2FGQMsdo8GhnTA4jqVee-2FsspkYqdTzfTonmT6VGd0iTNwNyuaJIH9ncuC6KJUM18-2FTK7GOkPx0-2BV6xiuo9JWkkmNtBxoeKC3T7q-2Fsu0X-2FXCDijlTWgZsN33WbtGBpxZWdaB-2FZZ-2BMdmibDnpRrXYswKEf10ShA32ll5D6j6e6fK8IVU4hvYdkDl74vumXm-2BGtBqUUCs4T9SbuUxhlcea7Z6SeVJo9nW881zJ-2FnjfN6Qi9z3-2BkUoBkmnRqqSreUgBudc-2Bxpa4eDggdTDiy6jnB2dMQME34NJOKwdQ8hwh-2FFZQHomBu3qeGd-2B9XVQTKIJFtgyERqRQXbxM-2FKN-2BHIuBF1to9r2AwgIZoOjEnqVc4gm8J8xA-3D-3D)

Beaverton Police Department
